projects.title: Trait system redesign: dynamic serving via trait-defined APIs
projects.summary: Major architecture change enabling traits to define their own API behavior for dynamic data serving without hardcoded transforms.
projects.previewAlt: Trait system redesign: dynamic serving via trait-defined APIs

blocks.body:
## Description:

Moved trait data from manifests to separate trait_<name>.yaml files. Enhanced trait definitions with schema, resolve, output, aggregations, queries sections. Added trait-api-schema.yaml, trait-template.yaml, and registry/handlers/. New traits: forked-from, path-dependencies, published, standalone-git, untracked. Deleted: git-submodules, mcp-tools, own-git-repo, upstream. 174 files changed across 50+ packages.

## Reasoning:

Previous system embedded trait data in manifests requiring hardcoded transforms. New design follows declarative-over-imperative: traits define their own schema and API behavior, packages provide data in separate files, API serves dynamically without code changes.

projects.title: Portfolio Editor Architecture and Feature Completeness
projects.summary: Full-featured web GUI for composing portfolio project pages from work reports with live preview, drag-drop, and controlled vocabulary integration.
projects.previewAlt: Portfolio Editor Architecture and Feature Completeness
projects.description: Web-based split-pane GUI for building portfolio project pages from work reports. Flask backend (port 9750) with vanilla JS frontend. Features: report browser with archive/unarchive, project CRUD with settings/content separation, block-based content editor, drag-drop from reports, live preview with click-to-edit overlays, tag autocomplete from controlled vocabulary, import report as project, deploy staging/production workflow.

blocks.body:
## Description:

Web-based split-pane GUI for building portfolio project pages from work reports. Flask backend (port 9750) with vanilla JS frontend. Features: report browser with archive/unarchive, project CRUD with settings/content separation, block-based content editor, drag-drop from reports, live preview with click-to-edit overlays, tag autocomplete from controlled vocabulary, import report as project, deploy staging/production workflow.

## Reasoning:

Built to replace manual YAML editing for portfolio project pages. The tool integrates work reports (stored in PostgreSQL) with portfolio projects (stored as YAML files). The modular architecture replaced the legacy 6-file JS layout using observer pattern to break circular dependencies. Event delegation eliminates memory leaks. Connection pooling prevents database exhaustion. Archive feature keeps reports panel uncluttered. Import feature provides one-click project creation from reports.

projects.title: vcsh support for git operations
projects.summary: Added vcsh support so git operations work in the Systems repo. The project name (--project) is now used to detect and use the corresponding vcsh repo for git commands.
projects.description: Added vcsh support so git operations work in the Systems repo. The project name (--project) is now used to detect and use the corresponding vcsh repo for git commands.

     name = "git_diff"

         """Find git changes: uncommitted work and the specified commit."""

         work_dir = context.work_dir or Path.cwd()
+        vcsh_repo = self._detect_vcsh_repo(context.project)
 
         # Check for uncommitted changes

+        uncommitted = self._get_uncommitted_diff(work_dir, vcsh_repo)
         if uncommitted:
             # Get summary stats for label

@@ -50,11 +55,11 @@ class GitDiffHandler(EvidenceHandler):
 
         # If a commit is specified, get that commit's diff

-            commit_diff = self._get_commit_diff(work_dir, context.commit)
+            commit_diff = self._get_commit_diff(work_dir, context.commit, vcsh_repo)

                 stats = self._get_diff_stats(commit_diff)

+                message = self._get_commit_message(work_dir, context.commit, vcsh_repo)
                 evidence.append(Evidence(
                     handler_name=self.name,
                     key=f"commit-{short_hash}",
@@ -70,6 +75,30 @@ class GitDiffHandler(EvidenceHandler):
 
         return evidence
 
+    def _detect_vcsh_repo(self, project: str) -> str | None:
+        """Detect if project corresponds to a vcsh repo.
+
+        Returns repo name if found, None otherwise.
+        """
+        if not project:
+            return None
+
+        # Check if vcsh repo exists with this name
+        try:
+            result = subprocess.run(
+                ["vcsh", "list"],
+                capture_output=True,
+                text=True,
+                timeout=5,
+            )
+            repos = result.stdout.strip().split('\n')
+            if project in repos:
+                return project
+        except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+            pass
+
+        return None
+
     def capture(self, evidence: Evidence, report_dir: Path) -> CapturedArtifact:
         """Write diff content to a .diff file in the report directory."""
         if not evidence.content:
@@ -106,50 +135,33 @@ class GitDiffHandler(EvidenceHandler):
             "content": artifact.get("content", ""),
         }
 
-    def _get_uncommitted_diff(self, work_dir: Path) -> str | None:
-        """Get diff of all uncommitted changes (staged + unstaged)."""
+    def _run_git(self, args: list[str], work_dir: Path, vcsh_repo: str | None, timeout: int = 30) -> str | None:
+        """Run a git command, using vcsh if specified."""
         try:
-            # Get both staged and unstaged changes
-            result = subprocess.run(
-                ["git", "diff", "HEAD"],
-                capture_output=True,
-                text=True,
-                cwd=work_dir,
-                timeout=30,
-            )
-            diff = result.stdout.strip()
-            return diff if diff else None
+            if vcsh_repo:
+                cmd = ["vcsh", vcsh_repo] + args
+                result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=timeout)
+            else:
+                cmd = ["git"] + args
+                result = subprocess.run(cmd, capture_output=True, text=True, cwd=work_dir, timeout=timeout)
+            return result.stdout.strip() if result.returncode == 0 else None
         except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
             return None
 
-    def _get_commit_diff(self, work_dir: Path, commit: str) -> str | None:
+    def _get_uncommitted_diff(self, work_dir: Path, vcsh_repo: str | None = None) -> str | None:
+        """Get diff of all uncommitted changes (staged + unstaged)."""
+        diff = self._run_git(["diff", "HEAD"], work_dir, vcsh_repo)
+        return diff if diff else None
+
+    def _get_commit_diff(self, work_dir: Path, commit: str, vcsh_repo: str | None = None) -> str | None:
         """Get diff for a specific commit."""
-        try:
-            result = subprocess.run(
-                ["git", "diff", f"{commit}~1..{commit}"],
-                capture_output=True,
-                text=True,
-                cwd=work_dir,
-                timeout=30,
-            )
-            diff = result.stdout.strip()
-            return diff if diff else None
-        except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
-            return None
+        diff = self._run_git(["diff", f"{commit}~1..{commit}"], work_dir, vcsh_repo)
+        return diff if diff else None
 
-    def _get_commit_message(self, work_dir: Path, commit: str) -> str:
+    def _get_commit_message(self, work_dir: Path, commit: str, vcsh_repo: str | None = None) -> str:
         """Get the commit message for a commit."""
-        try:
-            result = subprocess.run(
-                ["git", "log", "-1", "--format=%s", commit],
-                capture_output=True,
-                text=True,
-                cwd=work_dir,
-                timeout=10,
-            )
-            return result.stdout.strip()
-        except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
-            return ""
+        msg = self._run_git(["log", "-1", "--format=%s", commit], work_dir, vcsh_repo, timeout=10)
+        return msg or ""
 
     def _get_diff_stats(self, diff_content: str) -> str:
         """Parse diff to get stats summary like '3 files, +50/-10'."""

@@ -1005,26 +1010,65 @@ class WorkReport:
             )

+            pass

-    def _get_git_stats(self, commit: str) -> tuple:
+        return None
+
+    def _get_git_stats(self, commit: str, project: str = None) -> tuple:
         """Get git diff stats for a commit.
 
+        Supports both standard git repos and vcsh repos.
         Returns (files_changed, lines_added, lines_removed, diff_stat).
         """
         if not commit:
             return None, None, None, None
 
+        def run_git(args):
+            """Run git command, falling back to vcsh if needed."""
+            # Try standard git first
+            try:
+                result = subprocess.run(
+                    ["git"] + args,
+                    capture_output=True,
+                    text=True,
+                    check=True,
+                    cwd=SYSTEMS_ROOT,
+                )
+                return result.stdout.strip()
+            except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
+                pass
+
+            # Try vcsh if project provided
+            if project:
+                try:
+                    result = subprocess.run(
+                        ["vcsh", project] + args,
+                        capture_output=True,
+                        text=True,
+                        check=True,
+                    )
+                    return result.stdout.strip()
+                except (subprocess.CalledProcessError, FileNotFoundError):
+                    pass
+
+            return None
+
         try:
-            # Get numstat (machine-readable)
-            result = subprocess.run(
-                ["git", "diff", "--shortstat", f"{commit}~1..{commit}"],
-                capture_output=True,
-                text=True,
-                check=True,
-                cwd=SYSTEMS_ROOT,
-            )
-            shortstat = result.stdout.strip()
+            # Get shortstat (machine-readable)
+            shortstat = run_git(["diff", "--shortstat", f"{commit}~1..{commit}"])
 
             files_changed = None
             lines_added = None
@@ -1032,7 +1076,6 @@ class WorkReport:
 
             if shortstat:
                 # Parse "3 files changed, 50 insertions(+), 10 deletions(-)"
-                import re
                 m_files = re.search(r"(\d+) file", shortstat)
                 m_add = re.search(r"(\d+) insertion", shortstat)
                 m_del = re.search(r"(\d+) deletion", shortstat)
@@ -1041,18 +1084,11 @@ class WorkReport:
                 lines_removed = int(m_del.group(1)) if m_del else 0
 
             # Get human-readable diffstat
-            result = subprocess.run(
-                ["git", "diff", "--stat", f"{commit}~1..{commit}"],
-                capture_output=True,
-                text=True,
-                check=True,
-                cwd=SYSTEMS_ROOT,
-            )

-        except subprocess.CalledProcessError:

blocks.body:
## Description:

End-to-end test of copy-at-capture for all artifact types: image, code, terminal, video, doc, data.

## Reasoning:

Verifying Phase 4 implementation: every artifact type should produce a file in the per-report artifacts folder.

blocks.code:
def parse_artifact(spec: str) -> dict:
    """Parse an artifact specification string.

    Formats:
        image:/path/to/file.png:"Optional caption"
        code:src/file.py:10-25:"Caption"
        terminal:/path/to/session.txt:"Caption"
        video:/path/to/demo.mp4:"Caption"
        doc:/path/to/spec.pdf:"Caption"
        data:/path/to/metrics.json:"Caption"

    For code artifacts, lines are extracted at capture time and stored
    in the 'content' field. Line numbers become metadata for provenance.
    """
    # Split on first colon to get type
    parts = spec.split(":", 1)
    if len(parts) < 2:
        raise ValueError(f"Invalid artifact spec (missing type): {spec}")

    art_type = parts[0].strip()
    if art_type not in ARTIFACT_TYPES:
        raise ValueError(f"Unknown artifact type '{art_type}'. Valid: {', '.join(sorted(ARTIFACT_TYPES))}")
blocks.caption: parse_artifact function

blocks.code:
def parse_artifact(spec: str) -> dict:
    """Parse an artifact specification string.

    Formats:
        image:/path/to/file.png:"Optional caption"
        code:src/file.py:10-25:"Caption"
        terminal:/path/to/session.txt:"Caption"
        video:/path/to/demo.mp4:"Caption"
        doc:/path/to/spec.pdf:"Caption"
        data:/path/to/metrics.json:"Caption"

    For code artifacts, lines are extracted at capture time and stored
    in the 'content' field. Line numbers become metadata for provenance.
    """
    # Split on first colon to get type
    parts = spec.split(":", 1)
    if len(parts) < 2:
        raise ValueError(f"Invalid artifact spec (missing type): {spec}")

    art_type = parts[0].strip()
    if art_type not in ARTIFACT_TYPES:
        raise ValueError(f"Unknown artifact type '{art_type}'. Valid: {', '.join(sorted(ARTIFACT_TYPES))}")
